Name: Stela of Sa-rerut
Description: The representations and inscriptions on this stela are carved. The stela is divided into four different sections. In the lunette are two jackals on standards facing each other. Underneath them are three horizontal lines of text containing the offering formula. The middle section contains two mirrored offering table scenes. A man is seated on a chair with a backrest in front of a low offering table. Facing him is a kneeling woman. The lower part of the stela depicts three narrow registers with representations of sitting couples and women or standing individuals, each accompanied by an inscription. The lowermost register is very damaged but still shows traces of household scenes.
